data.title: Department of Mathematics
data.text:
JOB TITLE: Professor Emeritus

UC In Memoriam biography

RESEARCH AREA: Applied Mathematics

RESEARCH INTERESTS: Mathematical economics

SELECTED PUBLICATIONS:

Gérard Debreu. Introduction [On the work of Werner Hildenbrand]. In Economics essays, pages 1-4. Springer, Berlin, 2001.

Gérard Debreu, Wilhelm Neuefeind, and Walter Trockel, editors. Economics essays. Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 2001. A Festschrift for Werner Hildenbrand.

Gérard Debreu. On the use in economic theory of some central results of mathematical analysis. In Advances in mathematical economics, Vol. 1 (Tokyo, 1997), volume 1 of Adv. Math. Econ., pages 1-2. Springer, Tokyo, 1999.

Karl Menger. Ergebnisse eines mathematischen Kolloquiums. Springer-Verlag, Vienna, 1998. With contributions by J. W. Dawson, Jr., R. Engelking and W. Hildenbrand, a foreword by G. Debreu and an afterword in English by F. Alt, Edited by E. Dierker and K. Sigmund.

Gerard Debreu. On the preferences characterization of additively separable utility. In Constructing scalar-valued objective functions (Hagen, 1995), volume 453 of Lecture Notes in Econom. and Math. Systems, pages 25-38. Springer, Berlin, 1997.
